snippet: The country cited security concerns for tightening controls for a month around the conference, which about 80 heads of government are expected to attend.
abstract: France's Interior Min Bernard Cazenueve announces country will reinstate border checks during upcoming United Nations-sponsored climate change conference in Paris, citing security concerns.
lead_paragraph: The country cited security concerns for tightening controls for a month around the conference, which about 80 heads of government are expected to attend.

headline.main: France to Temporarily Reinstate Border Checks Around Time of Climate Talks
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; France: Security for Climate Talks
